author: [Anonymous]
text:
This position supervises on a constant, ongoing basis the translation of the First Selectman’s management philosophy, goals, and objectives into active terms that directly benefit each resident. The incumbent will assist the First Selectman substantially and effectively in the task of providing leadership in developing, achieving, and maintaining the best possible programs and services. Reports to the First Selectman and works collaboratively as a member of the First Selectman’s Management Team. 
This position coordinates activities of the Office of the First selectman with other divisions and departments. In addition, this position represents the First Selectman at meetings when required and appropriate; advises the First Selectman and Town Administrator, providing extensive professional assistance, project management, and recommendations on Town issues and performs highly responsible management work covering a broad range of municipal activities, including the supervision of staff assigned to the Office of the First Selectman. Work involves dealing with the public with tact and diplomacy, assisting the First Selectman with communications regarding citizen concerns and making independent decisions for the benefit of the organization. This is a professional position requiring extensive experience with policy development, legislation, intergovernmental relations, and lobbying, with exceptional analytical and communication skills.
Rules: You cannot use the words "Assistant Town Administrator"
Bonus: The title will be universally understood by future potential employers
Prize: You get to know my identity and will be the recipient of my enduring professional admiration.  
Go!
